did.unittitle: Trent Collection on Franklin Delano Roosevelt 1945-1949
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Josiah and Mary Duke Biddle Trent collected and donated the Trent Collection, including these materials on U.S. president Franklin Delano Roosevelt. Assorted printed materials about FDR, including his stamp collecting and obituary material; autographed portraits; and 2 signed letters from FDR dating from 1932 and 1933.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Trent Collection on Franklin Delano Roosevelt, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Trent Collection on Franklin Delano Roosevelt was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession(s) described in this finding aid: 2012-0204
This collection is minimally processed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Trent Collection on Franklin Delano Roosevelt was given to the Rubenstein Library as part of the Trent Collection by Josiah and Mary Duke Biddle Trent. It honors FDR, the 32nd president of the United States, who served in office from 1933 until his death in 1945.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes printed materials about FDR, including obituary materials and articles about his stamp collecting. Also contains 2 autographed letters from 1932 and 1933, and 2 autographed portraits of FDR.

did.unittitle: Kinkead, Eugene. "The Great Philatelist," The New Yorker. 1946 March 30
Repland, L. "A Humble Tribute to FDR," 1945
Sloane, George B. "The President Franklin D. Roosevelt Collection," Stamps. 1945 November 24.
Time Magazine issue re: FDR's death. 1945 April 23
Facsimile, enlarged, of U.S. Savings Bond, $200. 1946
Bush, Vannevar, OSRD. "Science: The Endless Frontier" report to the president, 1945
2 autographed letters from FDR, one as Governor of New York and one on White House stationary. 1932 and 1933
National Citizens Political Action Committee circular, undated (post-1945)
Ludwig, Emil. "Roosevelt in War," Free World. 1946 May
U.S. Dept. of Justice. Memorial Service for FDR. 1945 April 13
The New Republic, with Roosevelt supplements. 1946 April 15 and 1946 April 29
